section.title: SystemBuilder Overview
section.para: A system distribution is a set of operating system components, applications and configuration needed to deploy a system to perform a desired function. Using SystemBuilder you can create and maintain system distributions:

listitem.para: combine it with one or more applications,
set OS and application configuration parameters,
deploy it to clients using standard tools and methods,
update existing clients using standard package update tools such as YUM.

textobject.para: SystemBuilder takes various inputs (OS, applications, configuration files, etc.), combines that with an distribution definition file and creates a system distribution with deployment images and a package repository. Using the bootable media, you can deploy the distribution to one or more client machines. You can also update existing clients from the distribution package repository.

section.para: In summary, SystemBuilder is a production distribution life cycle manager for use in defining, building and maintaining system distributions that can be easily installed and updated on physical, virtual and cloud machines using industry standard deployment and update tools.
